guide.introduction: This tutorial shows how to connect a button to the TurtleBot power and gyro board.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This tutorial shows how to connect a button to the TurtleBot power and gyro board.

Relevant parts
  • Push Button, 33mm
  • 10K Resistor
  • Wire, 22 guage, 20"
  • (Optional) Button Mount
Tools
  • Soldering iron
  • Wire stripper/crimper

lines.text: A TurtleBot might be of use as well
lines.text_raw: A TurtleBot might be of use as well

lines.text: Solder one end of the 10K resistor to Pin 8 (5V) on the DB-25 connector of the TurtleBot power board.
lines.text_raw: Solder one end of the 10K resistor to Pin 8 (5V) on the DB-25 connector of the TurtleBot power board.

lines.text: Solder one of the wires onto Pin 14 (Ground) of the DB-25 connector on TurtleBot Power Board. (white wire in picture)
lines.text_raw: Solder one of the wires onto Pin 14 (Ground) of the DB-25 connector on TurtleBot Power Board. (white wire in picture)

lines.text: Solder the other wire onto Pin 6 (Digital Input 3) of the DB-25 connector on TurtleBot Power Board. (green wire in picture).
lines.text_raw: Solder the other wire onto Pin 6 (Digital Input 3) of the DB-25 connector on TurtleBot Power Board. (green wire in picture).

lines.text: Connect the other end of the 10K resistor to the wire attached to Pin 6. (green wire in picture)
lines.text_raw: Connect the other end of the 10K resistor to the wire attached to Pin 6. (green wire in picture)

lines.text: Solder the two wires onto the switch.
lines.text_raw: Solder the two wires onto the switch.

lines.text: Attach the button to your robot.
lines.text_raw: Attach the button to your robot.

lines.text: Try out this script on your ROS-configured TurtleBot laptop. This script makes the robot drive forward, pressing the button toggles motion on or off.
lines.text_raw: Try out [http://www.ros.org/wiki/MichaelFerguson?action=AttachFile&do=get&target=button_test.py|this script] on your ROS-configured TurtleBot laptop. This script makes the robot drive forward, pressing the button toggles motion on or off.
